intro: Lepanthes mulleriana, commonly known as the Müller's orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees in tropical rainforests. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. It has lance-shaped leaves and a short, erect stem. Lepanthes mulleriana is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its beauty and unique floral structure.
